greetings, i have an issue: Im flying with a spacecraft, everithing looks balanced and ok, and suddenly, the camera stops chasing it and it gets uncontrollable. It is a known bug? Can it be fixed? Do you know why it happens? The craft goes perfect ![p>

**Edited April 6, 2015 by juvilado**
Again trying another aircraft, when attach a docking port the bug happens again...

Moved to modded support, since it appears that you have mods installed.

Cheers,

~Claw

This was a problem with RealChutes parts mounted in symmetry back in 0.23, but I'm pretty certain that instance of it has long been fixed. Still possible something else is triggering it though, but update your mods.

If it's the problem I remember, it always triggers just above a certain altitude (5km, iirc) when Krakensbane activates (a game mechanic that changes from moving your ship around the universe to moving the universe around your ship.). Is this what you are experiencing?

> 
> This was a problem with RealChutes parts mounted in symmetry back in 0.23, but I'm pretty certain that instance of it has long been fixed. Still possible something else is triggering it though, but update your mods.
> If it's the problem I remember, it always triggers just above a certain altitude (5km, iirc) when Krakensbane activates (a game mechanic that changes from moving your ship around the universe to moving the universe around your ship.). Is this what you are experiencing?

Yes, it triggers about that altitude. It happened to me with different vessels. The last one, it started failing at the launchpad. Most of the cases a docking port is involved, id swear i put it correctly (ive done it dozens of times in other vessels) without altering its configurations. And for instance, when after the "kraken" i try to decouple to docking to "save" the upper stage, all the stage with the pilots vanishes...

Here we have another "wonderful" example:
